Uses of Class
app.Cart

    • Uses of Cart in app

      Methods in app with parameters of type Cart 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void Store.browseListener​(Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, Inventory inventory)
      browseListener takes in input for a selected item and adds it to the cart if the player has enough gold
      static void Store.cancelListener​(Inventory inventory, Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store)
      cancelListener semi-recursively keeps the player within the options loop to remove an item from their cart until the 'q' button is pushed.
      static void Store.checkoutListener​(Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, Inventory inventory)
      checkoutListener gets the total price for the player's cart, making sure that they can afford their whole cart then allows the purchase, exchanging the items for gold.
      static void Store.displayMenus​(Inventory inventory, java.lang.String menuSelection, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, Cart cart)
      based on menuSelection, sets and displays menu options, then calls helper functions to listen for responses to the menu options given, then appropriately handle them
      static void Store.displaySalables​(Inventory inventory, Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, java.lang.String mode)
      displaySalables pulls relevant information from player inventory/cart or store to display the correct options in order to place items in the cart, complete a sale from the cart, sell items back to the store, or remove items from the cart
      static void Store.listener​(Inventory inventory, Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, java.util.Scanner scan)
      listener waits for input and directs the player to the correct menu based on their input
      static void Store.placeInCart​(Inventory inventory, Cart cart, java.util.ArrayList<Product> store, java.util.Scanner scan)
      takes in input as a selection then adds the selected item to the cart if the player can afford to purchase the item
